label: 緒方洪庵
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 4:  Early Modern Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1991
説明文: (1810-63).  [His school], the Tekijuku [had] some six hundre young scholars from vitually every domain in the country go [and]...study the Dutch language and medicine in the 1840s and 1850s.  Among them were leaders of the modern intellectual movement for reform and enlightenment" such as Hashimoto Sanai and Fukuzawa Yukichi (p. 634). [適塾、橋本左内、福沢諭吉]"
